comments: Except for 1, 2, n such that sum_{k=1..n} (k mod 5)*C(n,k) is a power of 2. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 17 2002Numbers ending in 4 or 9. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jul 08 2006a(n) is the set of numbers congruent to {4,9,14} mod 15. - _Gary Detlefs_, Mar 07 2010
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 944
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1).
formula: G.f.: (4+x)/(1-x)^2. - _Paul Barry_, Feb 27 2003a(n) = 2*a(n-1) - a(n-2), n>1. - _Philippe DelÃ©ham_, Nov 03 2008a(n) = A131098(n+2) + n + 1. - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Aug 15 2009a(n) = 10*n - a(n-1) + 3, n>0. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 20 2010A000041(a(n)) == 0 mod 5 is the first of Ramanujan's congruences. - _Ivan N. Ianakiev_, Dec 29 2014
maple: a[1]:=4:for n from 2 to 100 do a[n]:=a[n-1]+5 od: seq(a[n], n=1..57); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Mar 16 2008
prog: (MAGMA) [5*n+4: n in [0..70]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 02 2011(PARI) a(n)=5*n+4 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 24 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
